posts.title: The Show Goes On
posts.content:
Coming through an IG announcement yesterday, Bentonville natives Jenny and Dave Marrs are returning to HGTV for the 3rd season of their show, Fixer to Fabulous.

  • Work in progress: Season 3 is still being filmed, but it's already full of renovations that will have you planning your own home makeover.
  • A little extra: In addition to their new season, Fixer to Fabulous will be presenting a spin-off series called Welcome Inn. This new series follows the couple as they make an 1880s home into a "functioning vacation rental."

You can learn more about this fabulous couple HERE.

posts.title: Tontitown Grape Festival
posts.content:
Who knew celebrating grapes could be so fun? The Tontitown Grape Festival is back for 122nd year, and it's all about tradition.

  • Stomping grounds: With live music, carnivals, and some good old-fashioned grape stomping, this annual festival celebrates Tontitown's rich, Italian history. The celebration will be from Aug. 3-7.
  • There's more: Throughout the week, you can also get a taste of authentic Italian cuisine with spaghetti dinners served every night, join the fun run, or enjoy live entertainment.

Find out more about the festival and its history HERE.

posts.title: Compostable Friendly
posts.content:
Local NWA business, Food Loops, cleans your plate for you. Working to "close the loop on food" Food Loops is the food-waste solution for Northwest Arkansas.

  • How it works: You send Food Loops an invite to your next event, and they do all the dirty work for you. They reduce the amount of food that enters the landfill and produce sustainable fertilizers for local growers.
  • Big milestone: Food Loops partnered with Tyson Foods in 2018. Since then, they have converted over 35 tons of food waste into soil for local markets. This is part of Tyson's zero-waste future efforts.

You can learn more about Food Loops by watching their documentary HERE.

posts.title: A New Way to Work
posts.content:
A leading residential real estate company is bringing its operational expertise to NWA. The company, called Commons, will be constructing a new remote work hub in Bentonville.

  • Sought after: As one of the best cities in the country to live in and one that is growing rapidly, Commons chose Bentonville earlier in the year as 1 of 5 cities to lay the groundwork for its remote work hub.
  • A new home: These projects will allow people to live remote while maintaining their current jobs. These multifamily units are reshaping the traditional view of work/life balance.

Listen to more about how Commons is creating new opportunities for remote work in our region HERE.

posts.title: Your Next Beer
posts.content:
With live music happening nearly every night in a venue in NWA, not much gets us more jazzed except for maybe one thing.. local craft beer.

  • Local attraction: A guide to local breweries gives guests and residents alike some great flavors from beer-makers across Northwest Arkansas.
  • More to come: With more breweries planned for the area, craft will be something we continue to make and enjoy.

What's your favorite local craft beer? Tell us HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Slight detour: Zion Road in Fayetteville will be closed for improvements until Aug. 20th.
  • Little olympics: A daycare in Fayetteville celebrated the start of the Olympics with their own opening ceremony.
  • Better safe than sorry: The Bentonville Fire Department is getting a new truck to fight aircraft fires.
  • For the fans: Wilson Park Pool is hosting Kayak Polo on Aug. 10th.
  • No "I" in team: You can't do it alone, and neither can we. Learn more about being featured in the newsletter HERE.
